metadata.title: CVE-2022-35230 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An authenticated user can create a link with reflected Javascript codeinside it for the graphs page and send it to other users. The payload canbe executed only with a known CSRF token value of the victim, which ischanged periodically and is difficult to predict.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-35230` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-agent2 - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-frontend-php - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-java-gateway - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-server-mysql - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 6.0.5rc1
zabbix-web-service - 6.0.5rc1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.5rc1').
